result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Michael Hickey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to report to probation intake and provide DNA sample by 6-29-2022.
Probation Review Hearing: September 23, 2022 at 1:30pm

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Pay all supervision fees, court costs, fees and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharge during period of probation. Unpaid amount to convert to civil judgment.
Restitution set at ZERO.
No violent contact with D.S. after completion of 10 Batterer's Intervention Program classes and with the victim's approval.

Batterer's Intervention Program.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.

AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Michael Hickey

defendant.name: Hickey, Christopher Michael
defendant.address: 10305 West Plum Tree Circle, #201, Hales Corners, WI 53130

records.addlTxt: Case set for a probation review hearing on 9/23/22 at 1:30 pm. A report was not filed. Review hearing is cancelled.
DV Court Review Update dated September 16, 2022; received and filed.

Defendant Christopher Michael Hickey in court with attorney Nicholas M Weege. Student Intern Paul Lasswell under the supervision of Assistant District Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea and sentencing hearing. State orally amends COUNT 1 to DISORDERLY CONDUCT Wisconsin statute 947.01(1) with Domestic Abuse Assessments enhancer statute 973.055(1).   Parties have reached a resolution.  Plea hearing held.  
  
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to AMENDED COUNT 1.

Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Christopher Michael Hickey in court with attorney Nicholas M Weege.  Mark Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status conference. Defense requests resolution date. Case adjourned to Branch 35 IN PERSON.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Christopher Michael Hickey in court with attorney Nicholas M Weege.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense requests status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Status conference scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DS

Defendant Christopher Michael Hickey in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Defendant Christopher Michael Hickey in custody.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Christopher Michael Hickey appeared by video means with Attorney.  Case retabbed to Judge Rosa, Branch 35 due to nature of charge.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d9e3cc7f-7791-ec2d-80d3-5bfcdc106eb3  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
